message.content:
cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY 

This paper is about discovering common edit patterns in code repositories to aid in the creation of quick fixes for code analyzers. This involves analyzing revision histories of code repositories to identify and cluster code edits into sets that can be described using an edit pattern. This work is relevant to software engineering (cs.SE) as it aims to improve the development process by providing tools to aid in the creation of bug-free and efficient code. It also involves natural language processing (cs.PL) as it involves clustering and describing code edits using patterns. Additionally, machine learning (cs.LG) is used to learn from the collective wisdom of programmers and identify useful edit patterns. Information retrieval (cs.IR) is also relevant as the paper involves searching through code repositories to identify relevant revisions and edits. Finally, cybersecurity (cs.CY) may also be relevant as the creation of bug-free code is important for ensuring the security of software systems.
